THE BELGIANS.Copy of letter from Sir Francis H.Villi,are, foriiariUj^ a replyfrom President of the Council to War Cabinet's oongra1foU4i^wi$..............1.. ,(Circulated flith reference to War Cabinet 489, Min. 8.)HAVRE.October 33rd 1910.Ho. 360Sir,With reference to your telegram Ho.110 of the 19th instantI have the honour to forward the reply from the President of theCouncil to the message of congratulation upon the recent successof the Allied arms in Flanders which v/ae addressed to him by theWar Cabinet.Oooreman was- visiting the liberated districts and it wassome little time before the message could be delivered. Thisaccounts for the delay in His Excellency's answer which has justbeen communicated to me.I have the honour to be with the highest respect,Sir,Your most obedient humble Servant,(Sgd) F.H.VI1LIERS. .The Rt.Hon,-A.J.Balfour, O.M., 24.P..,,!cc.&c. &c.t Le Gouvernsment beige est tres touohe dea chaleureueeafelicitations g.ue le Cabinet de $ierre britanniqua a bien voulului addresser i V occasion de la victoire remportee par 1'arm^ebeige, oombattant sous^leo ordree. de 3.M. le Roi aux coHe^s deaherolquea troupes alliees, Couronnement de quaJaa annees 4blutte et d'endurance, la viotoire dee -Flandwis ouvrer pour, lepeuple beige une ere nouvelle;, premiere revanche du droit outrageelle est le gage certain de l^etablissement d'unepaix juste. Leaadmirablee aoldate britanniquea pourront revandiquer une partglorieuse dans le triomphe dea peuple8licres at dans, la liberationprochaine de la Belgique.COOREMAN.
